ClinicalDocument.title: MADIGAN ARMY MEDICAL CENTER DISCHARGE SUMMARY

dischargeDispositionCode.displayName: See details in the CDA Body

nonXMLBody.text:
Allergy information is not available in this document. Please refer to Madigan’s outpatient system (CHCS or AHLTA) to obtain that information.
Note Type: Multidiscipline D/C Note Time: N/A Last Stored: 23 Mar 2006 Stored by: Provider, Good, MD Nurse, John RN MULTIDISCIPLINARY DISCHARGE NOTE Madigan Army Medical Center, Tacoma, WA
HOSPITALIZED FROM:22 Mar 2006 TO: 23 Mar 2006 TIME OF RELEASE DISPOSITION Discharge to home RELEASED TO CHIEF COMPLAINT ON ADMISSION: DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#1 Severe COPD w/ exacerbation on 5L as an outpt, PFTs mmm YY: DLCO 2.33, TLC 5.3, Vc 2.9, Frc 3.33, RV 2.4; Pre-bronchodilator: FVC 2.39, FEV1 1.16, FEV1/FVC 46%; Post-bronchodilator: FVC 2.54, FEV1 1.16, FEV1/FVC 46%; Severe obstruction w/ no post-bronchodilator response. DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#2 Cor pulmonale, normal LVEF and no wall motion abnormalities on echo this hospitalization w/ imparied relaxation, severely dilated and hypokinetic RV, RA silated, mild TR DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#3 Bronchiectasis DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#4 S/P tx for TB infection DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#5 H/O prostate CA DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#6 GERD DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#7 H/O hyponatremia (baseline 120-130) DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#8 Osteoporosis DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#9 HTN DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#10HLD DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES:#11"Irregular Heart Beat" INVASIVE PROCEDURES/SURGERIES (e.g., biopsy, colonoscopy, bronchoscopy, central lines): #1 CXR DATE:02JUN2001 IMPRESSION: 1. Coarse, irregular emphysematous change with regions of bibasilar probable fibrosis. This is consistent with history of COPD. It is impossible to exclude infiltrate on this study. 2. 15 mm right mid-lung nodular density. Differential includes pulmonary nodule vs. vessel. 3. Irregular right apical pleural thickening with associated lung volume loss. INVASIVE PROCEDURES/SURGERIES (e.g., biopsy, colonoscopy, bronchoscopy, central lines):

Continued...

PRIMARY CARE MANAGER: PATIENT EDUCATION DONE DURING HOSPITALIZATION #1
Discharging Nurse will print final copies for patient and record. DISCHARGING PHARMACIST:FEELBETTER, RICHARD, RPH DISCHARGING NURSE: NURSE, HELPER, RN DISCHARGING DOCTOR: PROVIDER, GOOD D. MD RESPONSIBLE RESIDENT: ATTENDING PHYSICIAN: BLUE, LESLIE L., MD Two copies of this form were printed, the signed copy was placed in the patient's inpatient record.
